Key Arguments: Misinformation is not a real problem but a pretext for government control.
The legislation would give ACMA excessive power to determine truth and censor dissenting opinions.
Censorship is dangerous and historically linked to totalitarian regimes.
The legislation could lead to political censorship and restrict free speech.
The government and certain institutions are exempt from the legislation, creating a double standard.
Notable Quotes: Misinformation is a fake problem. It’s not a risk or a threat.
Censorship is dangerous – not wrong ideas.
Nobody – especially not the government nor any of its agencies – has a monopoly on objective truth.
